subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Special Notice Regaurding Your Group Membership**
author: bruce halliday

I post in wav. format I believe when you convert the file from wav to mp3.=

certain aspects of the file are lost. If an mp3. file is a tenth of the si=
ze of
a wav. file where does the other 9/10's go.
 
If it is compressed the=
n it definitely loses quality. 
I think every nuance in a box file is cruci=
al for the 
correct interpretation of the file, sometimes the a word create=
d by the entity is not only
comprised of radio fragment but also static noi=
se mixed with the fragments of radio vocal
to form the message the entity w=
ishes to leave. I don't know the technical aspects of the file 
change but =
I think it's common sense that when you try to pour a gallon of water into =
a shot glass
all you wind up with is a shot glass full of water the rest is=
 spilled and lost.
 
I keep my files posted for 5 or less days, just long e=
nough for anyone that wants to listen can.
If your going to leave your file=
s posted indefinitely and keep adding to the folder then of course it will
=
put pressure on the storage space.
 
As far as posting a notice for every f=
ile, some of us may wish to listen from their e-mail or not 
have to go to =
the file section to listen, That's probably why that option is given.
If I =
didn't like the notices cluttering up my e-mail in box you can change that =
feature in the group
membership options. So if anyone does not want that fe=
ature they can turn it off and only read posts on the group.
 
It's not the=
 lack of space is the mismanagement of it by all of us. 
when I change my f=
iles from wav. to mp3 I hear a distinct difference, do it in an audio edito=
r and you can visually see the difference.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: warrior18eii@...: Wed, 30 Jan 2008 05:=
05:37 -0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Special Notice Regaurding Your Grou=
p Membership**






That's a great idea Steve and it was mentioned before =
but either no one noticed Misty's post or it was ignored. It would be a sha=
me though if people start loosing files because they are not paying attenti=
on to the owners instructions.Regards,Frank R.
----- Original Message ----F=
rom: Steve Hultay <urkel23@...>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comSent: Wednesd=
ay, January 30, 2008 6:06:23 AMSubject: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Special Notice Rega=
urding Your Group Membership**

Misty,I have and idea. One solution is to p=
ost Mp3 files instead of Wav. files or any other format. It seems like the =
Mp3's sound the same and are only 1/10th of the size. I think that would pr=
obably clear up 90 percent of the board right there. If i actually have mor=
e than a couple files from here on out, i will be attaching them to an e-ma=
il and not the board to save space here. And also, if people do post files =
maybe we can all just have one post that says we have uploaded files to our=
 folder instead of 30 audio announcements in a row that just seems to waste=
 a lot of e-mail space in the individual e-mails. And it also pushes the cu=
rrent topic on the board to another page and is lost for those who wanted t=
o share. Just my thoughts on helping the subject. I know we are all excited=
, but misty is right. I went to add a file the other day and the group was =
at 93 percent capacity, so it won't be long before we run out of space.-Ste=
ve H.--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "Misty" <bulletbabea@ ...> wrote:>> J=
ust a little friendly reminder that you all need to organize your > files b=
etter in the files area. Space is limited here and you are all > nearing th=
e 100% mark so try to keep your section under 5 megs. If > you need more sp=
ace use www.esnips.com and you can store 50 gigs to > share with the group =
or public.> > I think it is great you guys have so much to share I just wis=
h that > our yahoo group wasnt so limited on space (and that I wasnt so > l=
imited on time). But I have found a way around it. If just a few > people s=
igned up and shared using esnips they can invite others to > visit thier fi=
les and once they do they also get 50 gigs of free > space for audio pictur=
es or video or whatever you want to post.> > I was considering setting up o=
ne "group" account to start with and > inviting all members who post files =
to join it and be able to post to > the account. It will automatically noti=
fy everyone thats a member > when a file is added to it just like the yahoo=
 group does. It also > allows you to share with the public or privately if =
you so choose. > You can even allow your friends to post to your account if=
 you wish.> > This group has grown and expanded and we just need to make a =
few > changes to how we do things to keep it running more smoothly for the =
> future. I am hoping that you all will help me in this endeavor. I > know =
many of you have already adapted the idea to help us organize > and maintai=
n the group.> > I want you to keep sharing and to be able to share more! > =
> So please organize and not post stray files that are targets for > deleti=
on once the que is 100% full. And for your own sake, if no one > elses, be =
respectful to each other.> > MD>
